page.title: 09Homes in Norham
page.content: Houses in Norham are as varied as their occupants! Sandstone houses, a hundred years old, rub shoulders with their more modern brick-built, pebble-dashed neighbours. But the old houses have been modernised, and about half the houses in the village have some form of central-heating. Most have at least one open fire for burning solid fuel. The village has no mains gas supply. An average home is a semi-detached or terraced bungalow or two-storeyed house, with a garden, two or three bedrooms, bathroom with W.C., kitchen and main living room. Owing to the mass production of furniture, the village home contains much the same as its urban counterpart.
